name: contumacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of refusing to obey or respect the law in a way that shows contempt: He was found guilty of contumacy. Failure to respond to the summons was regarded as an act of contumacy.
More examplesFewer examplesTwenty ministers were summoned to the court and charged with contumacy.By refusing to act in accordance with the verdict, they were considered to be guilty of contumacy.They charged the rebels with contumacy and contempt of court.
